description: Convert colors across formats for seamless design-to-code workflows. Create lighter or darker variants, adjust saturation and hue, and generate palettes, schemes, and full swatch scales. Check contrast for WCAG compliance, pick readable text colors automatically, and validate color inputs with confidence.

capabilities.name: convert
capabilities.description: Converts a color from one format to another. Supports all major color formats including hex, rgb, rgba, hsl, hsla, oklch, oklab with full alpha/transparency support. Input can be any valid color string (hex, rgb, rgba, hsl, hsla, oklch, oklab, or named colors like 'red', 'blue'). Alpha values are preserved when converting between alpha-supporting formats, removed when converting to non-alpha formats. Available output formats: 'hex' (#FF0000), 'rgb' (rgb(255,0,0)), 'hsl' (hsl(0,100%,50%)), 'oklch' (oklch(63.3% 0.254 19.9)), 'oklab' (oklab(0.633 0.025 0.013)). Example: convert color '#FF0000' to format 'oklch'.

capabilities.name: lighten
capabilities.description: Increases the lightness of a color by a specified percentage amount. Perfect for creating lighter variations of colors for hover states, highlights, or design system variations.

capabilities.name: darken
capabilities.description: Decreases the lightness of a color by a specified percentage amount. Ideal for creating darker variations for active states, shadows, or depth in design systems.

capabilities.name: saturate
capabilities.description: Increases the saturation (intensity/vibrancy) of a color by a specified percentage amount. Use this to make colors more vivid and eye-catching.

capabilities.name: desaturate
capabilities.description: Decreases the saturation (intensity/vibrancy) of a color by a specified percentage amount. Perfect for creating muted tones, subtle backgrounds, or less prominent UI elements.

capabilities.name: rotate
capabilities.description: Rotates the hue of a color by specified degrees around the color wheel. Perfect for creating color harmonies, analogous colors, or systematic color variations.

capabilities.name: luminance
capabilities.description: Calculates the WCAG relative brightness of a color (0-1 scale, where 0 is pure black and 1 is pure white). Critical for accessibility compliance and determining if colors are light or dark.

capabilities.name: chroma
capabilities.description: Calculates the chroma (color intensity/purity) of a color (0-1 scale, where 0 is grayscale and 1 is maximum intensity). Useful for understanding color vibrancy and saturation levels.

capabilities.name: opacity
capabilities.description: Extracts the opacity/alpha value from any color format (0-1 scale, where 0 is fully transparent and 1 is fully opaque). Works with rgba, hsla, oklch, oklab, and any format that supports transparency. Essential for working with transparent colors and overlays.

capabilities.name: name
capabilities.description: Attempts to identify the common name of a color. Returns the color name if recognizable (e.g., 'red', 'blue', 'forestgreen'), otherwise returns the hex code. Useful for user-friendly color identification.

capabilities.name: palette
capabilities.description: Generates a harmonious color palette from a base color. Creates 6 evenly spaced colors around the color wheel. Perfect for creating color schemes, themes, or design system foundations.

capabilities.name: scheme
capabilities.description: Generates specific color harmonies from a base color. Supports complementary, triadic, tetradic, and other classic color theory relationships. Essential for creating balanced, professional color combinations.

capabilities.name: swatch
capabilities.description: Creates a complete 11-shade swatch from a base color (50, 100, 200...950). This is the industry standard for design systems like Tailwind CSS. Perfect for creating consistent light-to-dark variations.

capabilities.name: random
capabilities.description: Generates a random color in the specified format. Useful for testing, prototyping, or when you need inspiration for new color choices.

capabilities.name: contrast
capabilities.description: Calculates the WCAG contrast ratio between two colors (1-21 scale, where higher values mean better contrast). Essential for accessibility compliance - AA requires 4.5:1 for normal text, AAA requires 7:1.

capabilities.name: compare
capabilities.description: Performs comprehensive WCAG accessibility analysis between two colors. Returns contrast ratio, compliance levels (AA/AAA), and recommendations. Critical for ensuring your color combinations meet accessibility standards.

capabilities.name: text_color
capabilities.description: Determines the best text color (black or white) for maximum readability on a given background color. Automatically calculates which provides better contrast. Perfect for dynamic UI elements with variable backgrounds.

capabilities.name: is_valid_color
capabilities.description: Checks if a color string is valid and parseable. Supports hex, rgb, hsl, oklab, oklch formats, and named colors. Essential for input validation and error handling.
